question: kg m<sup>2</sup>is the unit of which of the following physical quantities?
explanation: kg m<sup>2</sup>is the unit of Moment of Inertia. The moment of inertia is a physical quantity which describes how easily a body can be rotated about a given axis. It is a rotational analogue of mass. Moment of Inertia = mass x (radius of gyration)<sup>2</sup>
